steps.title: List the attacks you want to improve your reaction against.
steps.content: List the attacks you want to improve your reaction against.

steps.title: Find a training partner.
steps.content: Find a training partner. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Ask your partner to execute the attack slowly.
steps.content: Ask your partner to execute the attack slowly. While your partner executes the attack, attempt to dodge or block it. Be wise to understand that certain attacks can't be blocked, for instance, blocking a punch will just get yourself hit both by the punch and by the hand or arm you chose to block with. You can also train an immediate counter-attack after successfully dodging the original attack. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the very same attack with the very same defense.
steps.content: Repeat the very same attack with the very same defense. If you think you're doing it right, then begin increasing the attack speed and the defense speed. Do this for about 10~15 minutes. Your body will learn to react to this particular situation. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Switch into another attack or into another defense (or both).
steps.content: Switch into another attack or into another defense (or both). Continue training for about 10~15 minutes. Your body will now learn to react to a different situation. Nevertheless, until here, you're always expecting the attack.

steps.title: Continue switching until you've successfully trained about 3 or 4 attacks and corresponding defenses.
steps.content: Continue switching until you've successfully trained about 3 or 4 attacks and corresponding defenses.

steps.title: Ask your partner to do one of the previously trained attacks at random.
steps.content: Ask your partner to do one of the previously trained attacks at random. Once again, begin slowly and keep increasing the attack speed if you're being successful in your training. Your body will now start to train on how to quickly identify the attack and respond accordingly. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat it all.
steps.content: Repeat it all. Repeating is the only way your reflexes will be trained.

steps.title: Find more partners, or at least keep finding ways of using different attacks.
steps.content: Find more partners, or at least keep finding ways of using different attacks. You want to improve fighting reflexes, not improve your reflexes when someone you know punches you in a very particular way. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Once you've mastered this, find two more people.
steps.content: Once you've mastered this, find two more people. Have one stand on each side of and in front of you, and execute the same attacks at random (It is best to have another person call out a certain number for each person, to avoid all of them attacking you at once.)
